meanings.definition: Not effectively conveying or communicating feelings or emotions.
meanings.sent1: The unexpressive painting failed to evoke any strong emotions in the viewers.
meanings.sent2: Her unexpressive face gave nothing away about how she was feeling inside.
meanings.sent3: The unexpressive robot tried to tell a joke, but it fell flat without any emotion.
meanings.sent4: The unexpressive sky seemed to mirror my own lack of enthusiasm on that dreary day.
meanings.sent5: The unexpressive music left the audience feeling indifferent and disconnected.

meanings.sent1: The unexpressive puppet hung limply on the strings, devoid of any life.
meanings.sent2: His unexpressive eyes revealed nothing of his thoughts or intentions.
meanings.sent3: The unexpressive cat lazily stretched out in the sun, looking utterly bored.
meanings.sent4: The unexpressive clock on the wall seemed to tick away time without any excitement.
meanings.sent5: The unexpressive performance left the audience feeling like they had wasted their time.

meanings.sent1: Her unexpressive response to the news made it hard to gauge her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The unexpressive tone of his voice gave no hint of the turmoil within him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpressive statue of the famous leader made him appear cold and distant.
meanings.sent4: The unexpressive mask she wore hid her true emotions from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The unexpressive atmosphere in the room made it hard to relax and enjoy the party.
